sections.purpose: To safely store chemicals, reagents, and solvents used in Pharmacognosy.
sections.scope: Applicable to storage of all laboratory chemicals in the Pharmacognosy department.
procedure: Segregate chemicals by hazard class (flammable, corrosive, oxidizer, toxic, etc.).
Arrange containers with clear labels facing outward and maintain an updated inventory list.
Store volatile and flammable liquids in dedicated flammable cabinets where required.
Keep the cabinet doors closed and locked when not in use.
Inspect the cabinet regularly for leaks, damaged containers, or expired chemicals.
Remove expired or degraded chemicals following the institutional waste disposal SOP.
precautions: Do not store incompatible chemicals together (e.g., acids with bases or oxidizers).
Avoid storing heavy containers on upper shelves.
Ensure proper ventilation if storing odorous or volatile substances.
Never store food or personal items in the chemical cabinet.
Wear appropriate PPE when handling chemicals inside the cabinet.
